item.title: The Fallacy of Small Functions
item.description: Decades of computer programming advice, best practices, and books have taught that small functions are good. That’s misleading at best and counterproductive at worst: increasing complexity rather than reducing it. For brevity, I’m going to say things are false or wrong without explaining because you already have a fantastic explanation: A Philosophy of Software Design by John Ousterhout.
